Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; exterior: band of blobs at rim between bands; below, left, vertical dividing band of hook maeander pattern; at centre, dot and billet pattern and at right, part of large maeander square.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Mature Animal Style. However, the lack of interior decoration, and the metopal decoration on the exterior consisting of dividng bands and large maeander pattern, are typical of the earlier Wild Goat Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 260, no. 512)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0135) (phase 2)
